description.narrative: Led by Rutgers with partners across Asia and Africa, the RHRN2 consortium enables young people in all their diversity to enjoy their SRHR in gender-just societies. Through access to SRHR information on- and offline, young people, especially girls, women and LGBTQIA+ are empowered to make decisions about their sexuality, voice their needs and claim their rights. RNW Media provides digital media expertise to reach and engage young people in the RHRN2 implementing countries. Together with partners and changemakers, we co-create digital media solutions that are contextualised and youth-centred – using digital media for knowledge strengthening, awareness raising and mass mobilisation for advocacy.
A critical mass reinforces positive norms and values regarding young people's SRHR and gender

description.narrative: Strengthened civil society for young people's SRHR and gender justice

title.narrative: 4.2.1 Number of capacity strengthening and linking and learning events organised

comment.narrative: Target setting will be conducted in 2022.
That includes the global linking & learning event, capacity strengthening on digital SRHR community building, Digital safety and security and social change.

title.narrative: 4.2.2 Number of people who participated in capacity strengthening and linking and learning events, from number of organisations

comment.narrative: Target setting will be conducted in 2022.

In 2021, data collection on the reach of the events was conducted before the establishment of the indicator framework. Therefore, only the number of participants was counted, without further disaggregation by organisation and other details. In 2022, data will be collected incorporating the indicator framework and with more focus on engagement.
